00057 /* avoid "Thundering Herd" with retry thread when multiple devices */
00058 #define I2O_RETRY(device)       (1 + HZ/10 + (device)->idx)

00061 static void dumpHrd(const char* name, struct HOST_REQUEST_DATA_RECORD* hrd)
00062 {
00063         dbg(1, "%10s c:%2d %x pci:%08x start:%d n:%d s:%d\n",
00064             name, hrd->chan&0x3f, hrd->chan, hrd->pci, hrd->start, 
00065             hrd->nsamples, hrd->stride );
00066 }
00067 
00068 
00069 #define DUMPHRD(var) dumpHrd(#var, var)
00070 
00071 #define CHAN(file) ((file)->f_dentry->d_inode->i_rdev&0x00ff)
00072 
00073 static Message *build_hrd_message(
00074         struct file *file, 
00075         unsigned pa,
00076         unsigned start,
00077         unsigned length,
00078         unsigned stride,
00079         int outbound,
00080         unsigned short cflags
00081         )
00082 {
00083         Message *message = (Message*)LBUF(file);
00084         switch(outbound){
00085         default:
00086         case 0:
00087                 message->header.type = outbound;
00088                 break;
00089         case 1:
00090         case -1:
00091                 message->header.type = 
00092                         MAKE_MT_COMMAND(outbound>0?
00093                                         MTC_HOST_REQUEST_DATA_ACQBOUND:
00094                                         MTC_HOST_REQUEST_DATA_HOSTBOUND);
00095         }
00096         message->header.length = 2*HRDR_SZ;
00097 
00098         message->payload.hrdr[0].pci = pa;
00099         message->payload.hrdr[0].start = start;
00100         message->payload.hrdr[0].nsamples = length;
00101         message->payload.hrdr[0].stride = stride;
00102         message->payload.hrdr[0].chan = CHAN(file)|cflags;
00103         
00104         memset( &message->payload.hrdr[1], 0, HRDR_SZ);
00105 
00106         PD(file)->last_direction_hack = outbound;
00107 
00108         dbg(1, "pci %08x nsamples %d chan %x ob:%d",
00109                 message->payload.hrdr[0].pci,
00110                 message->payload.hrdr[0].nsamples,
00111                 message->payload.hrdr[0].chan,
00112                 outbound);
00113 
00114         return message;
00115 }
00116 
00117 static Message *build_outgoing_raw_message(
00118         struct file *file, 
00119         unsigned pa,
00120         unsigned start_byte,
00121         unsigned nbytes,
00122         unsigned short cflags
00123         )
00124 {
00125         return build_hrd_message(
00126                 file, pa, start_byte/2, nbytes/2, 1, LDH_OUTBOUND, cflags);
00127 }
00128 
00129 static Message *build_incoming_raw_message(
00130         struct file *file, 
00131         unsigned pa,
00132         unsigned start_byte,
00133         unsigned nbytes,
00134         unsigned short cflags
00135         )
00136 {
00137         return build_hrd_message(
00138                 file, pa, start_byte/2, nbytes/2, 1, LDH_INBOUND, cflags);
00139 }

00141 
00142 static void buildRch(
00143         struct ReturnCommandHandler *rch,
00144         void (*handler)( 
00145                 struct ReturnCommandHandler* this, 
00146                 struct MESSAGE* messsage ),
00147         struct Acq200Path *path,
00148         struct IoMapping *kbuf,
00149         unsigned flags)
00150 {
00151         rch->handler = handler;
00152         rch->path = path;
00153         rch->device = path->device;
00154         rch->command_id = MAKE_ID_DTACQ(path->device->m_dpd.i2o_last_id_out+1);
00155         rch->rchReturn.valid = 0;
00156         rch->rchReturn.nbytes = 0;
00157         rch->rchReturn.kbuf = kbuf;
00158         rch->rchReturn.flags = flags;
00159         rch->lock = &path->device->m_dpd.rch.lock;
00160 }
00161 
00162 #define MFA_MASK 0x00ffffff
00163 
00164 int acq200_sendI2O_kbuf( struct Acq200Path* path, Message* message )
00165 {
00166         struct Acq200Device* device = path->device;
00167         unsigned mfa = readl(CSR(device, ACQ200_IQP));
00168 
00169     
00170         if (mfa == PCI_I2O_INVALID_MFA){
00171                 dbg(1, "ERROR: no i2o buffers available" );
00172                 return -EACQ32_NO_INCOMING_I2O;
00173         }else{
00174                 char* pdst = (char*)device->ram.va + (mfa&=MFA_MASK);
00175 
00176                 dbg(2,  "write Message %d to mfa 0x%08x\n", 
00177                     path->device->m_dpd.i2o_last_id_out+1, mfa );
00178           
00179                 message->header.id =
00180                         MAKE_ID_DTACQ(++device->m_dpd.i2o_last_id_out);
00181 
00182                 dbg(3, "message %4d %d 0x%08x 0x%04x 0x%04x\n",
00183                     message->header.id, 
00184                     message->header.length,
00185                     message->header.type,
00186                     message->payload.sdata[0], 
00187                     message->payload.sdata[1] );
00188 
00189                 dbg(3, "memcpy( %p %p %ld )", pdst, message,
00190                     (unsigned long)sizeof(MessageHeader)+message->header.length);       
00191 
00192                 memcpy(pdst, message, MESSAGE_ACTUAL_LEN(message));
00193 
00194                 dma_sync_single_for_device(
00195                         &device->pci_dev->dev, device->ram.pa + mfa, 
00196                         MESSAGE_ACTUAL_LEN(message), 
00197                         DMA_TO_DEVICE);
00198 
00199                 dbg(3, "writeln(mfa, CSR( device, ACQ200_IQP) 0x%08x",
00200                     mfa);
00201                 writel(mfa, CSR(device, ACQ200_IQP));
00202         
00203                 device->m_dpd.i2o_packets_outgoing++;
00204 
00205                 dbg(3, "return 0");
00206                 return 0;
00207         }
00208 }

00213 int acq200_copy_from_io_to_user(
00214         struct file *file, void *ubuf, const void *iobuf, int count )
00215 {
00216         dbg(1, "copy_to_user(%p, %p, %d)", ubuf, iobuf, count);
00217         if (acq200_stub_copy_to_user){
00218                 return 0;
00219         }
00220 
00221         return copy_to_user(ubuf, iobuf, count);
00222 }
00223 
00224 int acq200_copy_from_user_to_io(
00225         struct file *file, void *iobuf, const void *ubuf, int count )
00226 {
00227         dbg(1, "copy_from_user( %p %p %d", iobuf, ubuf, count);
00228         return copy_from_user(iobuf, ubuf, count);

00231 
00232 static void i2o_recycleRch(struct ReturnCommandHandler* self)
00233 {
00234 
00235         dbg(2, "self %p self->path %p self->rchReturn.kbuf %p",
00236             self, self->path, self->rchReturn.kbuf);
00237 
00238         if (self->path != 0){
00239                 rchRemove(self);
00240         }
00241         if (self->rchReturn.kbuf && (self->rchReturn.flags&RCH_KB_POOL)){
00242                 acq200_pool_free_mapping(self->device, self->rchReturn.kbuf);
00243         }
00244         acq200_pool_free_rch(self->device, self);
00245         dbg(2, "99");
00246 }
00247 
00248 static void i2o_recycleRchWrapper(
00249         struct ReturnCommandHandler* self,
00250         struct MESSAGE *unused)
00251 {
00252         i2o_recycleRch(self);   
00253 }

00255 
00256 static void i2o_handleReadMessageFile(
00257         struct ReturnCommandHandler* self,
00258         struct MESSAGE* response
00259         )
00260 /* output nsamples as self->clidata in BYTES WORKTODO - is this a good idea? */
00261 {
00262         int nsamples = response->payload.hrdr[0].nsamples;
00263         struct Acq200Path* path = rchSetSamplesAndGetPath(
00264                         self, response->payload.hrdr[0].start, nsamples);
00265 
00266         DUMPHRD(response->payload.hrdr);
00267         dbg(2, "nsamples %d path %p %s\n", 
00268             nsamples, path, path==0? "RECYCLE": "WAKEUP");
00269 
00270         dbg(1, "rch %p valid %d", self, self->rchReturn.valid);
00271         if (path != 0){
00272                 wake_up_interruptible(&path->return_waitq);
00273         }else{
00274                 i2o_recycleRch(self);
00275         }
00276 }

00279 static void acq200_dev_i2o_return_mfa(
00280         struct Acq200Device* device, unsigned mfa)
00281 {
00282         dbg(1,"mfa %08x", mfa);
00283         writel(mfa, CSR(device, ACQ200_OQP));
00284 }
00285 
00286 static void* acq200_dev_i2o_mfa2va(struct Acq200Device *device, u32 mfa)
00287 {
00288         return (void*)(unsigned long)device->dma_buf.va+(mfa&ACQ200_PCIWINMSK);
00289 }
00290 
00291 
00292 
00293 static int i2o_return_message(struct Acq200Device* device, unsigned mfa)
00294 {
00295         acq200_dev_i2o_return_mfa(device, mfa);
00296         device->m_dpd.i2o_packets_returned++;       
00297         return 0;
00298 }

00300 
00301 /*
00302  * Bottom Halves - ISR task level processing
00303  */
00304 
00305 static void acq200_processCommandMessageReturn(
00306         struct Acq200Device* device,
00307         Message* message
00308         )
00309 // called at bh (ISR-TASK) priority - make it quick
00310 {
00311         struct ReturnCommandHandler* rch;
00312 
00313         dbg(2,   " locating handler for id %d\n", message->header.id );
00314 
00315         list_for_each_entry(rch, &device->m_dpd.rch.list, list){
00316 
00317                 dbg(2, "rch id %d kbuf %p",
00318                     rch->command_id, rch->rchReturn.kbuf);
00319 
00320                 if (rch->command_id == message->header.id){
00321                         if (rch->handler){
00322 
00323                                 dbg(2, "calling handler for id %d", 
00324                                         message->header.id );
00325 
00326                                 rch->handler( rch, message );
00327         
00328                         }else{
00329                                 dbg(2, "NO HANDLER for %d", 
00330                                         message->header.id );
00331                                 i2o_recycleRch(rch);
00332                                 device->m_dpd.i2o_packets_discarded++;
00333                         }
00334 
00335                         return;
00336                 }
00337         }
00338 
00339 /*
00340  * here if not taken by any handler ...
00341  */
00342 
00343         dbg(1,   "ERROR - no handler available, discard\n" );
00344 }
00345 
00346 
00347 
00348 void acq200_streaming_isr_bh(unsigned long clidata)
00349 // check the message and distribute to interested parties
00350 // ideally we would have multiple buffers WORKTODO
00351 {
00352         struct Acq200Device* device = (struct Acq200Device*)clidata;
00353         u32 mfa;
00354 
00355         TIMESTAMP( device, 'i', "bh" );
00356 
00357         dbg(4, "entry\n" );
00358     
00359         while ((mfa = streamGet( &device->streambuf )) != STREAM_MFA_INVALID){
00360                 Message *message = 
00361                         (Message*)acq200_dev_i2o_mfa2va(device, mfa);
00362 
00363                 dbg(2,   " mfa 0x%08x type 0x%08x id %04d len %d\n", 
00364                     mfa, MT_ID(message->header.type), 
00365                     message->header.id,
00366                     message->header.length);
00367 
00368                 if ( acq200_debug ==7 ){
00369                         dbg(2, "SHORT CIRCUIT\n" );
00370                         i2o_return_message( device, mfa );
00371                         continue;
00372                 }
00373 
00374                 switch( MT_ID(message->header.type) ){
00375 #ifdef PGMCOMOUT
00376                 case MT_STREAM:
00377                         if ( device->m_dpd.streaming_enabled ){
00378                                 dbg(1,  " MT_STREAM:\n" );
00379                                 streamPut( &device->downstreambuf, mfa );
00380 // user code dQ's data
00381                                 wake_up_interruptible( &device->m_dpd.waitq ); 
00382                                 return;
00383                         }else{
00384                                 break;
00385                         }
00386 #endif
00387                 case MT_COMMAND_PACKET:
00388                         acq200_processCommandMessageReturn( device, message );
00389                         break;
00390                 default:
00391                         dbg(1,  " default: id 0x%08x\n", 
00392                             MT_ID(message->header.type) );
00393 
00394             
00395                         if ( device->m_dpd.aux_task_waiting ){
00396                                 device->m_dpd.aux_mfa = mfa;
00397                                 device->m_dpd.aux_task_waiting = 0;    
00398 // no race, rather discard
00399                                 wake_up_interruptible(&device->m_dpd.aux_waitq);
00400                                 return;
00401                         }else{
00402                                 device->m_dpd.i2o_packets_discarded++;
00403                                 dbg(1,  "discard %x\n", mfa );
00404                         }
00405                 }
00406                 i2o_return_message( device, mfa );              
00407         }
00408 }
00409

00411 
00412 
00413 void acq200_consume_i2o(struct Acq200Device* device, u32 mfa )
00414 {
00415         dbg(4, " OUTBOUND FIFO 0x%08x\n", mfa );
00416 
00417         device->m_dpd.i2o_packets_incoming++;
00418 
00419         if (acq200_debug == 8){
00420                 dbg(2,  "SHORT CIRCUIT\n" );
00421                 i2o_return_message( device, mfa );
00422         }else if ( streamPut( &device->streambuf, mfa ) < 0 ){
00423                 i2o_return_message( device, mfa );
00424                 device->m_dpd.i2o_packets_discarded++;
00425                 dbg(2, " discarding buffer  0x%08x\n", mfa );
00426 
00427                 TIMESTAMP( device, 'i', "disc" );
00428         }else{
00429                 device->m_dpd.i2o_last_in = (void*)(unsigned long)mfa;
00430 
00431 #ifdef PGMCOMOUT
00432                 device->m_dpd.streaming_message_delta_usecs =
00433                         acq32_getDeltaTime( 
00434                                 &device->m_dpd.tv_last_streaming_message,
00435                                 &device->m_dpd.tv_last_streaming_message  );
00436 #endif
00437                 TIMESTAMP( device, 'i', "put" );
00438 
00439                 dbg(4, " queued mfa 0x%08x\n", mfa );
00440 
00441                 tasklet_schedule(&device->m_dpd.streaming_isr_tasklet);            
00442                         
00443                 dbg(5, " queue_task acq200_streaming_isr_bh");
00444         }
00445 }
00446 
00447 static void i2o_handleLastMessage(
00448         struct ReturnCommandHandler* self,
00449         struct MESSAGE* response
00450         )
00451 {
00452         self->rchReturn.valid = 1;
00453         wake_up_interruptible(&self->path->return_waitq);
00454         i2o_recycleRch(self);
00455 }
00456 
00457 
00458 ssize_t acq200_bridge_read_generic (
00459         struct file* file, char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* posp,
00460         int hrd_code,
00461         struct IoMapping *kbuf)
00462 {
00463         struct Acq200Device *device = DEV(file);
00464         struct ReturnCommandHandler* rch = acq200_pool_alloc_rch(device);
00465         Message *message;
00466         unsigned pam;
00467         unsigned rch_flags = RCH_KB_POOL;
00468 
00469         if (rch == 0){
00470                 return -ETIMEDOUT;
00471         }
00472 
00473         if (kbuf == 0){
00474                 kbuf = acq200_pool_alloc_mapping(
00475                                 device, PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);    
00476                 if (kbuf == 0){
00477                         i2o_recycleRch(rch);
00478                         return -ETIMEDOUT;
00479                 }
00480                 pam = MK_DMABUF_OFFSET(kbuf, device);
00481         }else{
00482                 pam = kbuf->pa;
00483                 rch_flags = 0;
00484         }
00485 
00486         if (kbuf->len == 0){
00487                 i2o_recycleRch(rch);
00488                 acq200_pool_free_mapping(device, kbuf);
00489                 return -ENOMEM;
00490         }else{
00491                 count = min(count, (size_t)kbuf->len);
00492         }
00493 
00494 
00495 
00496         message = build_incoming_raw_message(
00497                         file, pam, *posp, count, hrd_code);
00498 
00499         buildRch(rch, i2o_handleReadMessageFile, PD(file), kbuf, rch_flags);
00500 
00501         dbg(1, "build count %u rch %p kbuf %p", 
00502             (unsigned)count, rch,  rch->rchReturn.kbuf);
00503 
00504         rchAppend(&device->m_dpd.rch.list, rch);
00505         acq200_sendI2O_kbuf(PD(file), message); 
00506 
00507         wait_event_interruptible(
00508                 PD(file)->return_waitq, rch->rchReturn.valid != 0);
00509 
00510         dbg(1, "rch %p valid %d", rch, rch->rchReturn.valid);
00511 
00512         switch(rchRemoveIfNotValid(rch)){
00513         case 1:
00514                 count = (size_t)rch->rchReturn.nbytes;
00515                 break;
00516         case 0:
00517                 dbg(1, "return -EINTR rch %p kbuf %p", 
00518                         rch, rch->rchReturn.kbuf);
00519                 /* leave ISR to recycle the buffer when/if it comes */
00520                 return -EINTR;
00521         default:
00522                 i2o_recycleRch(rch);
00523                 return -EFAULT;
00524         }
00525 
00526         dbg(1,"copy to user va:%p pa:0x%08lx count:%u",
00527             kbuf->va, kbuf->pa, (unsigned)count );
00528 
00529         dma_sync_single_for_cpu(&device->pci_dev->dev,
00530                         rch->rchReturn.kbuf->pa,
00531                         count,
00532                         DMA_FROM_DEVICE);
00533 
00534         acq200_copy_from_io_to_user(file, buf, rch->rchReturn.kbuf->va, count);
00535         *posp += count;
00536         i2o_recycleRch(rch);
00537         
00538         dbg(1, "return %u", (unsigned)count);
00539         return count;   
00540 }
00541 
00542 ssize_t acq200_bridge_write_generic (
00543         struct file *file, const char *buf, size_t count, loff_t * posp,
00544         int hrd_code)
00545 // write data as if from debug port
00546 {       
00547         struct Acq200Device *device = DEV(file);
00548         struct ReturnCommandHandler *rch = acq200_pool_alloc_rch(device);
00549         struct IoMapping *kbuf;
00550         Message *message;
00551         unsigned pam;
00552         unsigned rch_flags = RCH_KB_POOL;
00553         if (rch == 0) return -ETIMEDOUT;
00554 
00555         kbuf = acq200_pool_alloc_mapping(device, PCI_DMA_TODEVICE);
00556         if (kbuf == 0){ 
00557                 i2o_recycleRch(rch);
00558                 return -ETIMEDOUT;
00559         }
00560         pam = MK_DMABUF_OFFSET(kbuf, device);
00561 
00562         count = min(count, (size_t)kbuf->len);
00563 
00564         if (count == 0) return -ENOMEM;
00565 
00566 
00567         acq200_copy_from_user_to_io(file, kbuf->va, buf, count);
00568         
00569         message = build_outgoing_raw_message( 
00570                 file, pam, *posp, count, hrd_code);
00571 
00572         dma_sync_single_for_device(&device->pci_dev->dev,
00573                         device->dma_buf.pa,
00574                         count,
00575                         DMA_TO_DEVICE);
00576 
00577         buildRch(rch, i2o_recycleRchWrapper, PD(file), kbuf, rch_flags);
00578 
00579         dbg(1,"rch %p kbuf %p mbuf %08x", 
00580             rch, rch->rchReturn.kbuf, message->payload.hrdr[0].pci );
00581 
00582         rchAppend(&device->m_dpd.rch.list, rch);
00583         acq200_sendI2O_kbuf(PD(file), message);
00584 
00585 /*
00586  * and then? - WORKTODO: need to recycle kbuf
00587  */     
00588         *posp += count;
00589 
00590         dbg(1, "99 returning %u", (unsigned)count);
00591         return count;   
00592 }
00593 
00594 ssize_t acq200_bridge_write (
00595         struct file *file, const char *buf, size_t count, loff_t * posp)
00596 // write data as if from debug port
00597 {       
00598         dbg(1, "count %d", (int)count);
00599 
00600         return acq200_bridge_write_generic (
00601                 file, buf, count, posp, HRD_CHAN_IS_FILE );
00602 }
00603 
00604 ssize_t acq200_bridge_read (
00605         struct file* file, char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* posp)
00606 {
00607         return acq200_bridge_read_generic(
00608                 file, buf, count, posp, HRD_CHAN_IS_FILE, USE_POOL);
00609 }
00610 
00611 ssize_t acq200_bridge_readAB (
00612         struct file* file, char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* posp)
00613 {
00614         struct Acq200Device *device = DEV(file);
00615         struct IoMapping mapping;
00616         /* @todo do the AB toggle thing */
00617         struct DmaBuf *dma_buf = &device->AB[0];
00618         
00619         mapping.va = dma_buf->va;
00620         mapping.pa = dma_buf->pa;
00621         mapping.len = min(dma_buf_len(dma_buf), user_max_buf);
00622 
00623         dbg(1, "count %d buffer pa 0x%08lx", (int)count, mapping.pa);
00624 
00625         return acq200_bridge_read_generic(
00626                 file, buf, count, posp, 
00627                         HRD_CHAN_IS_FILE|HRD_ABS_PCI, &mapping);
00628 }
00629 
00630 void _recycle(struct Acq200Path *path, int ibuf)
00631 {
00632         dbg(1, "buffer%c", ibuf? 'B': 'A');
00633 
00634         if (path->rchAB[ibuf]){
00635                 i2o_recycleRch(path->rchAB[ibuf]);      
00636                 path->rchAB[ibuf] = 0;
00637         }
00638 }
00639 
00640 void acq200_bufferABrecycle(struct file *file, struct BufferAB_Ops *ops)
00641 {
00642         struct Acq200Path *path = PD(file);
00643 
00644         if (ops->ci.recycle&BUFFER_A_FLAG){
00645                 _recycle(path, BUFFERA);
00646         }
00647         if (ops->ci.recycle&BUFFER_B_FLAG){
00648                 _recycle(path, BUFFERB);
00649         }
00650 }
00651 
00652 static int fillDeviceStatus(
00653         struct BufferAB_Ops *ops, struct Acq200Path *path)
00654 {
00655         int buffer = path->ab_next;
00656         struct RchReturn* rr = &path->rchAB[buffer]->rchReturn;
00657 
00658         dbg(2, "buffer%c", buffer? 'B': 'A');
00659 
00660         if (rr->valid){         
00661                 dma_sync_single_for_cpu(
00662                         &path->device->pci_dev->dev, rr->kbuf->pa,
00663                         rr->nbytes, DMA_FROM_DEVICE
00664                 );
00665                 ops->ds.full |= BUFFER_FLAG_LUT[buffer];
00666                 ops->ds.sid[path->ab_next] = rr->start_id;
00667                 ops->ds.len[path->ab_next] = rr->nbytes;
00668                 if (rr->nbytes == 0){
00669                         ops->ds.full |= FULL_EOF;
00670                 }
00671                 path->ab_next = buffer == BUFFERA? BUFFERB: BUFFERA;
00672                 return 1;
00673         }else{
00674                 return 0;
00675         }
00676 }
00677 
00678 static void acq200_bufferAB_queue(struct file *file, int buffer)
00679 {
00680         struct Acq200Path *path =PD(file);
00681         struct Acq200Device *device = DEV(file);
00682         struct ReturnCommandHandler* rch = acq200_pool_alloc_rch(device);
00683         struct DmaBuf *dma_buf = &device->AB[buffer];
00684         struct IoMapping mapping;
00685         Message *message;
00686 
00687         dbg(2, "01 buffer%c", buffer? 'B': 'A');
00688 
00689         path->rchAB[buffer] = rch;
00690 
00691         mapping.va = dma_buf->va;
00692         mapping.pa = dma_buf->pa;
00693         mapping.len = min(dma_buf_len(dma_buf), user_max_buf);
00694 
00695         message = build_hrd_message(
00696                 file, mapping.pa, path->sid++, mapping.len/2,
00697                 1, LDH_INBOUND,
00698                 HRD_CHAN_IS_FILE|HRD_ABS_PCI|HRD_READ_NEXT);
00699         
00700         buildRch(rch, i2o_handleReadMessageFile, PD(file), 
00701                  &path->bufferMappings[buffer], !RCH_KB_POOL);
00702         rchAppend(&device->m_dpd.rch.list, rch);
00703 
00704         dbg(2, "acq200_sendI2O_kbuf %p", message);
00705 
00706         acq200_sendI2O_kbuf(PD(file), message); 
00707 }
00708 
00709 int i2o_missed_int_checker(void *arg)
00710 {       
00711         struct Acq200Device *device = (struct Acq200Device*)arg;
00712         wait_queue_head_t waitq;
00713 
00714         init_waitqueue_head(&waitq);
00715 
00716         while(!kthread_should_stop()){
00717                 int timeout = wait_event_interruptible_timeout(
00718                         waitq, 0, I2O_RETRY(device));
00719                 if (timeout != 0){
00720                         break;
00721                 }else{
00722                         static int msgn;
00723                         int rc = acq200_handle_incoming_message(device);
00724 
00725                         ++msgn;
00726                         if (rc == 1){
00727                                 info("%d backstop handled lost irq %d", 
00728                                      device->idx, msgn);
00729                         }else{
00730                                 if ((msgn&0x1f) == 0){
00731                                         dbg(1, "backstop idle %d", msgn);
00732                                 }
00733                         }
00734                 }
00735         }
00736         return 0;
00737 }
00738 
00739 int acq200_bufferABaction(struct file *file, struct BufferAB_Ops *ops)
00740 {
00741         struct Acq200Path *path = PD(file);
00742         
00743         int rc;
00744 
00745         acq200_bufferABrecycle(file, ops);
00746 
00747         if (path->rchAB[BUFFERA] == 0){
00748                 acq200_bufferAB_queue(file, BUFFERA);
00749         }
00750         if (path->rchAB[BUFFERB] == 0){
00751                 acq200_bufferAB_queue(file, BUFFERB);
00752         }
00753 
00754         dbg(2, "wait valid %d timeout %d",
00755                 path->rchAB[path->ab_next]->rchReturn.valid,
00756                 ops->ci.timeout);
00757 
00758         
00759 
00760         rc = wait_event_interruptible_timeout(
00761                 PD(file)->return_waitq, 
00762                 path->rchAB[path->ab_next]->rchReturn.valid != 0,
00763                 ops->ci.timeout);
00764 
00765 
00766         dbg(2, "wait done %s", rc==0? "TIMEOUT": rc<0? "ERROR": "OK");
00767         
00768         if (rc == 0){
00769                 err("TIMEDOUT");
00770                 return -ETIMEDOUT;
00771         }else if (rc < 0){
00772                 if (rc != -ERESTARTSYS) err("rc:%d", rc);
00773                 return rc;
00774         }
00775 
00776         ops->ds.full = 0;
00777         
00778         if (fillDeviceStatus(ops, path)){
00779                 fillDeviceStatus(ops, path);
00780         }
00781         
00782         return 0;
00783 }
00784 
00785 
00786 static void _cleanup_on_bridge_release(struct Acq200Path *path)
00787 {
00788         struct Acq200Device *device = path->device;
00789         struct ReturnCommandHandler *rch_cursor;
00790 
00791 cleanup:
00792         list_for_each_entry(rch_cursor, &device->m_dpd.rch.list, list){
00793                 dbg(2, "path %p want %p rch %p kbuf %p",
00794                             rch_cursor->path, path, rch_cursor, 
00795                             rch_cursor->rchReturn.kbuf);         
00796 
00797                 if (rch_cursor->path == path){
00798                         dbg(1, "WARNING: last chance to recycle %d",
00799                             rch_cursor->command_id);
00800                         i2o_recycleRch(rch_cursor);
00801                         goto cleanup;                   
00802                 }
00803         }
00804 }
00805 
00806 static int acq200_bridge_release_message(
00807         struct inode *inode, 
00808         struct file *file,
00809         Message *message
00810 )
00811 {
00812         struct Acq200Path *path = PD(file);
00813         struct Acq200Device *device = path->device;
00814         struct ReturnCommandHandler *my_rch = acq200_pool_alloc_rch(device);
00815 
00816         while(my_rch == 0){
00817                 err("null rch. RETRY");
00818                 my_rch = acq200_pool_alloc_rch(device);
00819         }
00820 
00821         buildRch(my_rch, i2o_handleLastMessage, path, 0, RCH_KB_POOL);
00822         rchAppend(&device->m_dpd.rch.list, my_rch);     
00823 
00824         acq200_sendI2O_kbuf(path, message);
00825 
00826         wait_event_interruptible(path->return_waitq, 
00827                                  my_rch->rchReturn.valid != 0);
00828 
00829         dbg(1, "done waiting valid: %d", my_rch->rchReturn.valid);
00830 
00831         if (my_rch->rchReturn.valid == 1){
00832                 i2o_recycleRch(my_rch);
00833         }
00834         /* this to free any trapped rch */
00835         _cleanup_on_bridge_release(path);
00836 
00837         return acq200_release(inode, file);
00838 }
00839 
00840 int acq200_bridge_release_generic (
00841         struct inode *inode, struct file *file, int hrd_code
00842 )
00843 {
00844         struct Acq200Path *path = PD(file);
00845         
00846         dbg(2, "path->last_direction_hack %d", path->last_direction_hack);
00847 
00848         switch(path->last_direction_hack){
00849         case LDH_OUTBOUND:
00850                 return acq200_bridge_release_message(
00851                         inode, file,
00852                         build_outgoing_raw_message(
00853                                 file, 0, 0, 0, hrd_code|HRD_CHAN_EOF));
00854         case LDH_INBOUND:
00855                 return acq200_bridge_release_message(
00856                         inode, file,
00857                         build_incoming_raw_message(
00858                                 file, 0, 0, 0, hrd_code|HRD_CHAN_EOF));
00859         default:
00860                 _cleanup_on_bridge_release(path);
00861                 return acq200_release(inode, file);
00862         }
00863 }
00864 
00865 int acq200_bridge_release (
00866         struct inode *inode, struct file *file
00867         )
00868 {
00869         return acq200_bridge_release_generic(
00870                 inode, file, HRD_CHAN_IS_FILE );
00871 }
00872 
00873 
00874 void rchInit(struct Acq200Device* device, struct ReturnCommandHandler *rch)
00875 {
00876         if (rch == 0){
00877                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&device->m_dpd.rch.list);
00878                 spin_lock_init(&device->m_dpd.rch.lock);
00879         }else{
00880                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&rch->list);
00881                 rch->handler = NULL;
00882                 rch->lock = &device->m_dpd.rch.lock;
00883         }
00884 }
